results.title: Plan to Bar Foreign Muslims by Donald Trump Might Survive a Lawsuit
results.abstract: On Tuesday Mr. Trump said he would exclude only foreign Muslims, not returning citizens. That distinction, legal specialists said, made it far less likely the courts would strike it down.

results.title: Muslims in Donald Trump’s Old Neighborhood Say, Come Get to Know Us
results.abstract: Since Mr. Trump advocated barring Muslims from entering the country, some residents of Queens, his former borough, urged him to come back and rediscover their diversity and patriotism.

results.abstract: A report by the House Armed Services Committee’s Republican members is critical of a deal in which five Taliban detainees were swapped for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl.

results.title: Obama Calls for End to Bigotry, in Implicit Rebuke of Donald Trump
results.abstract: The president appeared to use the 150th anniversary of the amendment abolishing slavery to challenge the anti-Muslim politics espoused by the Republican candidate.

results.title: Jeb Bush Jumps In at a ‘Life of the ‘Party’ Event
results.abstract: When asked who he would invite to a party at the White House, Mr. Bush said Winston Churchill and Neil Armstrong — but not Donald J, Trump.

results.title: Shipyard Accused of Botching Coast Guard Repairs Settles Case
results.abstract: Bollinger Shipyards, which was hired to retrofit patrol boats, agreed to pay to the government $8.5 million. The boat had to be abandoned.

results.title: Hillary Clinton Says Donald Trump’s Muslim Proposal Harms U.S. Antiterror Efforts
results.abstract: In a somber critique of the Republican front-runner, Mrs. Clinton acknowledged Americans’ fears and anxieties but said Mr. Trump’s proposal to block non-American Muslims from entering the country was “dangerous.”

results.title: John Kasich Rules Out Being a Running Mate
results.abstract: Asked if he would ever agree to run as vice president on a Trump ticket, the governor ruled out the job entirely, saying he wouldn’t run for vice president “on any ticket.”

results.title: Senate Approves Overhaul of No Child Left Behind Law
results.abstract: President Obama is expected to sign the bill, which would restore authority for school performance and accountability to districts and states after a long period of federal control.

results.title: Jeb Bush Reveals How Religion Informs His Day

results.abstract: Republican leaders in the House and Senate are indicating that this Friday’s deadline for passing a spending agreement will almost certainly slip, with work required through the weekend and perhaps well into next week to wrap things up.

results.title: Idea Behind Donald Trump’s Plan to Bar Muslims Has Some Deep Roots
results.abstract: Mr. Trump’s proposal to stop all Muslims from entering the United States has been panned, but while Muslims have not been the targets of such policies in the United States, the desire to keep certain kinds of people out of the country is not unprecedented in American history.

results.title: Americans Attracted to ISIS Find an ‘Echo Chamber’ on Social Media
results.abstract: As the White House takes on the challenge of the Islamic State, it is focusing on the online community of sympathizers in the United States, who number in the hundreds and fit no single profile.
results.byline: By SCOTT SHANE, MATT APUZZO and ERIC SCHMITT
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

multimedia.caption: A collection of posts from Twitter accounts sympathetic to the Islamic State. Lions, a reference to warriors as “lions of Allah,” are a popular symbol. Some users praise the recent killings in San Bernardino, Calif., while others offer advice to prevent hacker groups like Anonymous from disabling pro-Islamic State accounts.

results.title: Robert E. Macdonald Wins 3rd Term as Mayor of Lewiston, Maine
results.abstract: The race was a classic clash between generations and ideologies, and Ben Chin, an activist with a liberal alliance, substantially outspent the incumbent, Robert E. Macdonald.

results.title: Anxiety Grows in Texas With Syrians Due to Arrive Soon
results.abstract: The expected arrival of 21 of the refugees in the state this week has intensified concerns and fears about accepting Syrians in the wake of the Paris attacks last month.
results.byline: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and JULIA PRESTON
